item.title: Kailash-Mansarovar Yatra to resume soon? India-China reach 6 big decisions - The Times of India
item.description:
Kailash-Mansarovar Yatra to Resume Soon? India-China Reach 6 Big Decisions

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

This article discusses the recent agreements made by India and China regarding the resumption of the Kailash-Mansarovar Yatra, highlighting six significant decisions that are expected to impact bilateral relations.

  • Resumption of the Kailash-Mansarovar Yatra was affirmed by both nations.
  • Six major decisions were outlined in a recent meeting.
  • The agreements aim to enhance cooperation in pilgrimage activities.
  • Infrastructure improvements are planned along the travel route.
  • Increased safety measures are to be implemented for pilgrims.
  • Diplomatic discussions focused on broader bilateral issues.
Notable Quote: 'Both sides are committed to a peaceful resolution and infrastructure development.' - Diplomatic spokesperson

The recent decisions reflect a thaw in relations and a commitment to facilitating one of the most revered pilgrimages for many Indians.

item.title: 13 dead after ferry with over 100 passengers capsizes near Gateway of India in Mumbai; rescue operations - The Times of India
item.description:
13 dead after ferry with over 100 passengers capsizes near Gateway of India in Mumbai

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Rescue operations are currently underway following the tragic capsizing of a ferry, resulting in the death of 13 individuals and leaving over 100 passengers affected.

  • The ferry capsized near the iconic Gateway of India in Mumbai.
  • Over 100 passengers were onboard during the incident.
  • Rescue efforts have been initiated to locate missing passengers.
  • Authorities are investigating the cause of the capsizing.
"This is a tragic event, and we are focused on rescue efforts right now." - Local official

This incident highlights the ongoing issues related to maritime safety in the region and the need for regulatory oversight.

item.title: Rahul Gandhi claims 2 Cong workers killed due to ‘excessive police force’ in UP, Assam - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rahul Gandhi claims Congress workers killed due to ‘excessive police force’ in UP, Assam

Date: Dec 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Leader of opposition Rahul Gandhi alleged that two Congress workers died due to excessive police force during protests in Uttar Pradesh and Assam.

  • Prabhat Pandey and Mridul Islam were the deceased Congress workers.
  • Gandhi condemned the actions of police and called for justice for the families of the victims.
  • The Congress party was protesting against various issues including violence in Manipur.
  • Police claimed no injurious actions occurred during the protests.
  • Post-mortem examinations are pending to ascertain the exact causes of death.
“I offer my deepest condolences to their grieving loved ones. These families deserve full justice.” - Rahul Gandhi

This incident raises concerns over police conduct during protests and highlights ongoing political tensions in the regions ruled by the BJP.

item.title: Rs 9.25 Lakh: Madhya Pradesh Government's Air Travel Cost Per Day - NDTV
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Parliament session LIVE: 'Congress distorting facts,' says Amit Shah on Ambedkar remark row - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Parliament session LIVE: 'Congress distorting facts,' says Amit Shah on Ambedkar remark row

Date: December 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Congress party has strongly criticized Union Home Minister Amit Shah for his comments regarding Dr. BR Ambedkar, demanding an apology amid ongoing tensions in Parliament.

  • The Winter Session of Parliament is nearing its end, concluding on December 20, with multiple bills on the agenda.
  • Amit Shah accused Congress of distorting facts and misrepresenting his comments on Ambedkar during recent debates.
  • Shah emphasized that he had praised Ambedkar's contributions while alleging that the Congress party has historically insulted him.
  • Opposition members have called for Shah's resignation over his remarks, prompting protests.
  • Shah declared that the uproar is an attempt by Congress to deflect attention from its electoral failures.
“The people who denied Babasaheb Ambedkar are the ones trying to protest in his name,” Amit Shah stated.

As the session unfolds, tensions escalate, with Congress leaders continuing their demands for accountability from the BJP.

item.title: 2 dead after ferry with passengers capsizes near Gateway of India in Mumbai; rescue operations underway - The Times of India
item.description:
Ferry Capsizes Near Gateway of India, Two Confirmed Dead

Publication Date: Recent Update
Source: Times of India

The tragic incident of a ferry capsizing near the Gateway of India has resulted in the death of two individuals, with rescue operations currently underway.

  • Incident occurred near the iconic Gateway of India in Mumbai.
  • Casualties reported: Two confirmed dead.
  • Rescue teams are actively involved in search and recovery efforts.
"We are doing everything we can to rescue those who may still be in the water." - Local Authority

This incident highlights ongoing safety concerns regarding passenger ferries in busy locations.

item.title: Ferry capsizes off Mumbai near Gateway of India; two dead, 77 passengers rescued - The Hindu
item.description:
Mumbai Ferry Capsizes Near Gateway of India, 13 Confirmed Dead

Published on: December 18, 2024 | Source: Press Trust of India

A tragic incident occurred when a private ferry capsized off the coast of Mumbai, resulting in the death of 13 individuals, including Naval personnel. Rescue operations are ongoing for other missing passengers.

  • Thirteen casualties reported, with several critically injured.
  • The accident occurred when the ferry, Neelkamal, collided with a Navy craft during engine trials.
  • Over 110 passengers were on board; most have been rescued and taken to hospitals.
  • Indian Navy and Coast Guard are conducting joint operations to recover those missing.
  • Chief Minister confirmed that search efforts are focused on locating seven to eight missing passengers.
“A Navy craft undergoing engine trials lost control and collided with a passenger ferry Neel Kamal off Karanja, Mumbai.” - Indian Navy Official

The situation remains critical as emergency services continue to look for any remaining survivors and assess the full extent of this tragic event.

item.title: CAT Result 2024 LIVE Updates: Result shortly at iimcat.ac.in - The Indian Express
item.description:
CAT Result 2024 LIVE Updates: Result shortly at iimcat.ac.in

Date & Source: Upcoming at iimcat.ac.in

The Indian Institute of Management (IIM) Calcutta has released the final answer keys for the Common Admission Test (CAT) 2024.

  • Final answer keys now available on iimcat.ac.in.
  • Provisional answers were reviewed with no changes made.
  • Results expected to be released soon, accessible via registration number and password.
  • Analysis indicates that CAT 2024 was easier compared to the previous two years.
  • Approximately 2.93 lakh candidates appeared for the exam.
“The overall attendance was approximately 89 per cent.”

Candidates need a valid CAT score to register for postgraduate programmes at IIMs and participating colleges.

item.title: My words twisted; Congress anti-Ambedkar, anti-Constitution, says Amit Shah - The Hindu
item.description:
Amit Shah Accuses Congress of Distorting His Comments on Ambedkar

Date: December 18, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Union Home Minister Amit Shah accused the Congress party of twisting his remarks regarding B.R. Ambedkar, claiming they misrepresent his views on the Constitution. He proposed exploring legal actions against the party for these distortions.

  • Shah claims Congress is anti-Ambedkar, anti-Constitution, and anti-reservation.
  • Shah argues that Congress has a history of distorting facts and misleading the public.
  • Prime Minister Modi defended Shah's remarks and criticized Congress's narrative.
  • Shah responded humorously to calls for his resignation from Congress leaders.
  • The controversy is significant in the context of the recent Lok Sabha election results.
“I belong to a party that can never insult Babasaheb Ambedkar.” - Amit Shah

The ongoing dispute highlights tensions between the BJP and Congress, particularly surrounding issues of caste and representation in Indian politics.

item.title: Mumbai Boat Accident: Boat Carrying Over 30 People Overturns Near Gateway of India (Watch Video) - Lokmat Times
item.description:
Mumbai Boat Accident: Boat Carrying Over 30 People Overturns Near Gateway of India

Date: December 18, 2024 Source: Lokmat Times

A boat carrying passengers from the Gateway of India in Mumbai to the Elephanta Caves capsized near the gateway. Preliminary reports indicate that the ferry Neelkamal, en route to Elephanta, has sunk with approximately 30 to 35 passengers on board. Nearby boats quickly responded to assist in rescuing passengers. Currently, there is no information regarding the cause of the incident.

  • The incident occurred around 4 pm on Wednesday.
  • Rescue efforts are being coordinated by the Navy, Coast Guard, and Marine Police.
  • 11 Navy boats, 3 Marine Police boats, and 1 Coast Guard boat are in the area.
  • 4 helicopters are conducting Search and Rescue operations.
  • No casualties have been reported as of now.
— Lokmat Times (@lokmattimeseng) December 18, 2024

The incident highlights safety concerns regarding ferry services in the area, as public ferries are commonly used to transport visitors to the Elephanta Caves.

item.title: Nude man enters women’s coach of Mumbai local train, sparks safety concerns - The Indian Express
item.description:
Nude Man Enters Women's Coach of Mumbai Local Train, Sparks Safety Concerns

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Indian Express

A man, without any clothes, entered the women’s compartment of an air-conditioned local train halted at Mumbai’s Ghatkopar railway station, creating panic among women passengers.

  • The incident was captured on video, leading to viral circulation online.
  • The Government Railway Police stated the man was mentally unwell.
  • A ticket checker intervened and handed the man over to the police.
  • The incident raised concerns regarding safety in women-only coaches.
“Keeping homeless individuals and trespassers away from stations has been a major challenge for authorities.”

The incident underscores ongoing passenger safety issues, especially in designated women's compartments, highlighting the need for improved security measures in the railway system.

item.title: Activist claims that Abujhmad encounter was fake, four children injured - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Activist Claims Abujhmad Encounter Was Fake; Four Children Injured

Date: Recent

Source: Hindustan Times

Activists and villagers in Abujhmad allege that seven individuals killed by police were not Maoists but local villagers, with four children injured during the incident.

  • Activists claim that five of the seven killed were villagers working in fields.
  • Four children sustained serious injuries and reportedly did not receive medical help for three days.
  • Police deny the claims, stating that the children were used as human shields by Maoists.
  • The incident occurred in the villages of Kummam and Lekawada under Rekhawaya Panchayat, Narayanpur district.
  • Human rights activists express concern over the ongoing incidents affecting tribal children in the region.
“The deaths and injuries of tribal children in this ongoing campaign by security forces in Bastar should alarm the nation.” - Rinchin, Human Rights Activist

The incident has raised serious concerns over police conduct and the safety of villagers in the ongoing conflict with Maoists.

item.title: Starlink Device Found In Manipur Not Working, Incompatible: Forensics - NDTV
item.description:
Starlink Device Found In Manipur Not Working, Incompatible: Forensics

Date: December 23, 2023 Source: NDTV

Manipur authorities have reported that a Starlink dish and router recovered from insurgents are non-functional and incompatible in the state.

  • The devices were retrieved by security forces during an operation in Imphal East.
  • Starlink is currently not available in India and has not been licensed to operate there.
  • The situation has raised concerns about the implications of satellite-based internet technology in conflict areas.
  • Starlink's parent company, SpaceX, has faced regulatory challenges in the country since 2021.
  • The region has experienced ongoing ethnic violence, leading to increased security and communication concerns.
“Starlink satellite beams are turned off over India and were never on in the first place.” - Elon Musk

The discovery of the Starlink device amidst ongoing violence in Manipur has fueled concerns about potential external influences on local conflicts.

item.title: 'Insolence': Uddhav Thackeray lambasts Amit Shah over Ambedkar remark - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Uddhav Thackeray Criticizes Amit Shah Over Ambedkar Comments

Date: Dec 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Uddhav Thackeray condemned union minister Amit Shah's remarks about Dr. B.R. Ambedkar, labeling them as 'insolent' and questioned the NDA's response to the controversy.

  • Thackeray criticized Shah for saying that taking Ambedkar's name had become fashionable.
  • He demanded action from Prime Minister Modi against Shah for his comments.
  • The remarks led to protests by several MPs from the opposition INDIA bloc in Parliament.
  • Kiren Rijiju, minister for parliamentary affairs, defended Shah, accusing the Congress of insulting Ambedkar.
"The manner in which Amit Shah spoke in the Parliament yesterday, he displayed insolence... Who are you? Ambedkar ji is a personality not bound by any side." - Uddhav Thackeray

This controversy highlights ongoing tensions between the BJP and opposition parties over representation and respect for historical figures like Dr. Ambedkar.

item.title: Two soldiers die while loading ammunition during training exercise in Bikaner - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Tragic Incident Claims Lives of Two Soldiers During Training in Bikaner

Date: Dec 18, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Two soldiers of the Indian Army tragically died due to an explosion while loading ammunition during a training exercise in Bikaner.

  • The incident occurred at Mahajan field firing range.
  • A sudden explosion happened as soldiers were loading ammunition, resulting in two fatalities and one serious injury.
  • The deceased soldiers are Ashutosh Mishra from Deoria and Jitendra from Dausa.
  • This marks the second fatal incident in the Bikaner range within days.
  • A court of inquiry has been initiated to investigate the cause of the explosion.
“The charger exploded while the soldiers were loading the ammunition,” said the defence spokesperson.

This sad occurrence highlights the risks associated with military training exercises and has led to renewed calls for safety measures.

item.title: Delhi court grants 7-day interim bail to Delhi riots accused Umar Khalid - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Court Grants Interim Bail to Umar Khalid for Wedding

Date: Dec 18, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Umar Khalid, a former JNU student leader, has been granted seven days of interim bail by a Delhi court to attend a family wedding, marking a significant moment in his ongoing legal battle.

  • Khalid was granted bail from December 28 to January 3, 2025.
  • He has been in custody since September 2020 under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA).
  • This is his first grant of bail after multiple applications over four years.
  • Khalid's most recent bail request was previously denied on December 6.
  • His lawyer argues that he should be treated equally to other co-accused who were granted bail.

Khalid has claimed there is no physical evidence linking him to the 2020 Delhi riots.

This interim bail order is a notable development in the case that has caused significant public and media attention since the riots and Khalid's subsequent arrest.

item.title: Breaking | Umar Khalid Gets 7 Days Interim Bail In Delhi Riots Larger Conspiracy Case - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Umar Khalid Granted 7 Days Interim Bail in Delhi Riots Case

Publication Date: January 3, 2025   Source: Indian Courts

A Delhi Court has granted interim bail to Umar Khalid for a week, allowing him to attend a family wedding amidst allegations related to the 2020 North-East Delhi riots. The bail comes with several conditions aimed at ensuring compliance during this period.

  • The bail is valid for 7 days.
  • Khalid must not contact any witness or individuals connected to the case.
  • He is prohibited from using social media during this timeframe.
  • Meetings are restricted to family and friends, and he must remain at home or wedding venues.

Khalid is required to surrender by the evening of January 3, 2025. His previous bail application had been rejected, leading to ongoing legal proceedings.

item.title: ‘Courts doors always open’: Supreme Court on protesting farmers refusing talks with Punjab govt panel - Hindustan Times
item.description:
‘Courts doors always open’: Supreme Court on protesting farmers refusing talks with Punjab govt panel

Date: Dec 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Supreme Court affirmed that its doors are open to the protesting farmers after they rejected discussions with a Punjab government committee.

  • The court emphasized that farmers can directly present their demands.
  • The Punjab government reported ongoing efforts to engage with farmer leaders.
  • Jagjit Singh Dallewal, a key farmer leader, is on a hunger strike, pressing for a legal guarantee of Minimum Support Price (MSP) on crops.
  • The Supreme Court noted the health concerns of Dallewal and instructed medical assistance from the Punjab government.
“We clarify that court's doors are always open to any suggestion or demand by farmers directly or through their authorised representative.”

This situation highlights the ongoing tension between the Punjab farmers and the state government, with the Supreme Court offering a potential avenue for resolution.

item.title: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra likely to be part of simultaneous polls JPC: Sources - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Priyanka Gandhi Vadra likely to join JPC for simultaneous polls

Date: Dec 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Congress party leaders are expected to participate in a Joint Parliamentary Committee to evaluate the introduction of legislation for simultaneous elections.

  • Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and other Congress MPs are likely to represent the party.
  • The bills concerning simultaneous elections were introduced in Lok Sabha after significant debate.
  • Opposition groups have expressed concerns, labeling the legislation as anti-constitutional.
  • Support for the legislation comes from 32 political parties, while 15 oppose it.
  • Amit Shah announced that the bill would be handed over to a JPC for further discussion.
“It is against the federalism of our nation. We are opposing the bill,” said Priyanka Gandhi Vadra.

The deliberations in the JPC will be vital as the government aims to push through the simultaneous election legislation amid differing opinions within the political landscape.

item.title: Simultaneous polls: Priyanka Gandhi, Shrikant Shinde likely to be on joint committee of Parliament - The Hindu
item.description:
Simultaneous Polls: Priyanka Gandhi and Shrikant Shinde Likely to Join Parliamentary Committee

Published - December 18, 2024 03:17 pm IST

The BJP is in the process of selecting seasoned MPs for a parliamentary panel focusing on simultaneous poll bills, with Congressional nominees including Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and Manish Tewari.

  • The Congress representatives include Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, Manish Tewari, Randeep Surjewala, and Sukhdeo Bhagat.
  • The panel may total 31 members, with the BJP and its allies holding a majority.
  • Critics of the bills argue they undermine the federal structure.
  • Priyanka Gandhi has labeled the proposed legislation as "anti-constitutional" and harmful to federalism.
“The State government is not subordinate to the Central government or Parliament. The Bills take away the autonomy of the State Assembly.” – Kalyan Banerjee, TMC MP

item.title: Farmers protest: Supreme Court says Court doors always open and suggestion, demand charter can be brought for discussion - The Hindu
item.description:
Farmers protest: Supreme Court says Court doors always open and suggestion, demand charter can be brought for discussion

Date & Source: December 18, 2024 - The Hindu

The Supreme Court has invited farmers protesting at Delhi’s borders to present their issues, stating that its “doors are open.” The portrayal of ongoing tensions surrounding farmers' demands for a legally binding minimum support price has heightened as the court continues to monitor the situation.

  • The Supreme Court asserts its willingness to hear farmers' grievances directly or via representatives.
  • Justice Surya Kant leads the bench and emphasizes consideration of all stakeholders' viewpoints.
  • Farmers have refused to engage with a high-powered committee set up by the court.
  • The Punjab government reported on the health of farmers’ leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal, who is on a hunger strike.
  • The next hearing is scheduled for December 19, 2024.
“The Court will consider the issues while taking into consideration the viewpoints of all stakeholders involved.”

The Supreme Court's ongoing involvement highlights the critical nature of farmers' protests as they continue to seek legislative assurances on crop pricing.

item.title: NEET PG Counselling 2024: MCC issues important notice regarding resignation facility, check details here - The Times of India
item.description:
NEET PG Counselling 2024: Important Notice on Resignation Facility

Publication Date: Not availableSource: Not available

This article outlines important updates regarding the resignation facility for NEET PG Counselling 2024, providing candidates with crucial information on how to proceed.

  • The Medical Counselling Committee (MCC) has issued guidelines regarding the resignation process.
  • Candidates must understand the implications of resigning from the counselling process.
  • The notice aims to ensure a smooth counselling experience for all applicants.
"Ensure you are fully aware of the consequences before resigning from the process." - MCC Official

This notice is vital for NEET PG aspirants to plan their actions accordingly and make informed decisions regarding their counselling journey.
